content:
• Wednesday, November 9, 2011
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain's (NASDAQ:GMCR) growth story appears to have been ”pumped up by...

    Green Mountain's (NASDAQ:GMCR) growth story appears to have been ”pumped up by shenanigans,” says Whitney Tilson. The big question here is the company's inventories, which skyrocketed 356% Y/Y. “It looks to me like they pulled a lot of demand forward last quarter," Tilson says, "and stuffed the channel." Now, with that game over, the company could be in big trouble. One caveat: Tilson's currently short the stock. GMCR -34.8% AH. (video)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM | 4 Comments
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain's (NASDAQ:GMCR) FQ4 disaster (I, II, III) is taking a toll on some other coffee...

    Green Mountain's (NASDAQ:GMCR) FQ4 disaster (I, II, III) is taking a toll on some other coffee stocks. JVA -9%. PEET -4.2%. SBUX -0.7%. GMCR now -32.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • AMSC

    Hard-luck wind turbine component maker American Superconductor (AMSC +11.3%) was a big winner...

    Hard-luck wind turbine component maker American Superconductor (AMSC +11.3%) was a big winner today, taking off after reporting FQ2 revenue of $20.8M (-78.8% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.44, beating consensus by $2.3M and $0.12. While guiding for Q3 revenue of just $15M ($22.5M consensus), AMSC, whose backlog grew 30% Q/Q in Q2, expects Q4 revenue to "roughly double" from Q3 levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its call for FQ2 revenue of $11.1B-$11.2B, largely above an $11.1B...

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its call for FQ2 revenue of $11.1B-$11.2B, largely above an $11.1B consensus. Share now +4.1% AH. (CSCO FQ1) (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • SPRD

    More on Spreadtrum's (NASDAQ:SPRD) Q3 report: Average selling price for chips fell roughly 16%...

    More on Spreadtrum's (NASDAQ:SPRD) Q3 report: Average selling price for chips fell roughly 16% Y/Y. 2.4% of outstanding shares repurchased during quarter. Company expects Q4 revenue of $188M-$194M, above $185.6M consensus. Expects to double quarterly dividend to $0.10/share. Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • PEGA

    Pegasystems (NASDAQ:PEGA): Q3 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $96.3M (+1% Y/Y) misses...

    Pegasystems (NASDAQ:PEGA): Q3 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $96.3M (+1% Y/Y) misses by $15M. Shortfall blamed on weak software license signings and deferred license revenue recognition. Company expects 2011 revenue of $410M and EPS of $0.61, below consensus of $443.3M and $1.16. Expects 2012 revenue of $500M, below $513M consensus. Shares -13.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • AAP

    Advance Auto Parts (NYSE:AAP): FQ3 EPS of $1.41 beats by $0.24. Revenue of $1.47B (+4% Y/Y) beat...

    Advance Auto Parts (NYSE:AAP): FQ3 EPS of $1.41 beats by $0.24. Revenue of $1.47B (+4% Y/Y) beat by $10M. Same-store sales +2.2% Y/Y. $100M in shares repurchased at average price of $58.81. AAP +3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI): Net income per share of $2.26. Net income avaliable to shareholders of $444M....

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI): Net income per share of $2.26. Net income avaliable to shareholders of $444M. Shares -6.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • CSCO

    More on Cisco's FQ1: Product revenue up 3% Y/Y, service revenue (stronger recurring streams) up...

    More on Cisco's FQ1: Product revenue up 3% Y/Y, service revenue (stronger recurring streams) up 12%. Gross margin (a closely-watched figure) was 62.3%, down from 64.3% in year-ago period, but up from FQ4's 61.6%.  R&D expenses fell 7% Q/Q, and SG&A expenses 2%, thanks to restructuring efforts. $1.5B in shares repurchased at average price of $15.37. CSCO +1.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    More from Green Mountain Coffee Roasters' (NASDAQ:GMCR) FQ4 report: Full-year sales of $2.651B...

    More from Green Mountain Coffee Roasters' (NASDAQ:GMCR) FQ4 report: Full-year sales of $2.651B were up 95% Y/Y and non-GAAP EPS of $1.64 was up 113%. The company sees FQ1 EPS (ex-items from acquisition and legal expense from SEC inquiry) coming in at $0.35-$0.40 vs. $0.35, and FQ1 sales growth of 85-90%. Shares now -26.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO): FQ1 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $11.26B (+5% Y/Y) beats...

    Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO): FQ1 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $11.26B (+5% Y/Y) beats by $240M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR): FQ4 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $711M...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR): FQ4 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $711M (+96% Y/Y) misses by $49.5M. Volatility on the stock was up going into results; after hours, GMCR -31.3%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 19 Comments
  • ORA

    Geothermal energy provider Ormat Technologies (ORA -6.8%) sold off today after filing for a...

    Geothermal energy provider Ormat Technologies (ORA -6.8%) sold off today after filing for a $1.5B mixed shelf registration. The company says it will use the proceeds from the sale for "general corporate purposes."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • SYKE

    Sykes Enterprises (SYKE -4.2%) drifts towards its lows for the day after Stifer Nicolaus...

    Sykes Enterprises (SYKE -4.2%) drifts towards its lows for the day after Stifer Nicolaus downgrades the shares on valuation, citing the company's growth challenges and volatility of its margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • DLB

    Dolby Labs (DLB -10.2%) is cut to Neutral with a lower price target at Piper Jaffray, citing...

    Dolby Labs (DLB -10.2%) is cut to Neutral with a lower price target at Piper Jaffray, citing many near-term headwinds that are buffeting the technology licenser: trends in CE/PC shipments; a Y/Y decline in Blu-Ray players; the impact of Thai floods on sales; and the exclusion of a DVD playback application from Windows 8 (NASDAQ:MSFT).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • DGIT

    Ad network owner DG (DGIT -16.1%) is getting clobbered after reporting Q3 revenue of $84.6M...

    Ad network owner DG (DGIT -16.1%) is getting clobbered after reporting Q3 revenue of $84.6M (+52% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.69 - numbers that proved underwhelming after accounting for the acquisitions of MediaMind and EyeWonder. In addition, DG is announcing Scott Ginsburg, who has been CEO since 2003, will step down at the end of the year, and be replaced by COO Neil Nguyen.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • DIOD

    Diodes (DIOD -16.6%) shares sink after Q3 results miss expectations and the semiconductor firm...

    Diodes (DIOD -16.6%) shares sink after Q3 results miss expectations and the semiconductor firm gives downward Q4 guidance. CEO Keh-Shew Lu sees continuing broad-based weakness, particularly within consumer and PCs. Benchmark calls the company "classically cyclical," in that when global economies weaken, gross margin also can sink.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • BHC

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX -4.2%) trades lower following yesterdays disappointing Q3 report, as...

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX -4.2%) trades lower following yesterdays disappointing Q3 report, as Well Fargo cuts the shares to Market Perform on the back of the poor numbers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • GTIV

    Gentiva (GTIV +14.7%) shares continue to rise following disclosure of another big insider...

    Gentiva (GTIV +14.7%) shares continue to rise following disclosure of another big insider purchase. A director purchased 81K shares of the company, after a group of GTIV execs had disclosed purchases, including CFO Eric Slusser's 60K-share buy. The stock is down 85% YTD amid uncertainty over Medicare reimbursement rates in the home health industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • FEIC

    FEI (FEIC -4.7%) dips after McAdams Wright cuts the shares to Hold on valuation. The stock has...

    FEI (FEIC -4.7%) dips after McAdams Wright cuts the shares to Hold on valuation. The stock has bolted ahead of the pack during the recent "rip-your-face-off" rally we've experienced, having gained over 50% since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (ROVI -37.2%) is Nasdaq's biggest loser after Q3 earnings plunged, expenses soared and...

    Rovi (ROVI -37.2%) is Nasdaq's biggest loser after Q3 earnings plunged, expenses soared and expected revenue growth was lowered. Canaccord's continued faith aside, at least three analysts weigh in with downgrades and huge price target cuts. John Vinh of Collins Stewart sees no near-term catalysts, as "many of the growth drivers we had been anticipating have been pushed to late 2012."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • SATCQ

    Solar supplier Satcon (SATC -4.3%) dips on a ThinkEquity downgrade to Sell. The firm cites...

    Solar supplier Satcon (SATC -4.3%) dips on a ThinkEquity downgrade to Sell. The firm cites concern over the company's deteriorating gross margins and potential cash flow issues.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) clock a 2.2% gain on a dismal market day that sees the retailer...

    Shares of Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) clock a 2.2% gain on a dismal market day that sees the retailer stand as the biggest advancer in the S&P 500. Behind the mystery of the outperformance is a note from Cleveland Research saying channel checks by the firm confirm Best Buy may post its first monthly gain in same-store sales in six quarters.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • MKTG

    Responsys (MKTG -23%) takes a hit after its Q3 EPS misses estimates. Earnings soared fourfold on...

    Responsys (MKTG -23%) takes a hit after its Q3 EPS misses estimates. Earnings soared fourfold on a jump in revenue in its professional services unit, but the company warns that the current quarter will come in below analysts' expectations. It now expects revenue to be in the range of $34M to $35M, below analysts' estimates $36M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • ASH

    Ashland (ASH -10.8%) gets hit after its FQ4 beats estimates, but net losses widened due to an...

    Ashland (ASH -10.8%) gets hit after its FQ4 beats estimates, but net losses widened due to an actuarial loss as its pension plans weighed down the bottom line.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • NILE

    ComScore's report on retail E-Commerce sales (previous) showing strong gains in the Jewelry...

    ComScore's report on retail E-Commerce sales (previous) showing strong gains in the Jewelry & Watches category doesn't quite dovetail with Blue Nile's (NILE -30.5%) disastrous Q3 report. The fly in the ointment could be the higher wholesale diamond prices that online jewelry sellers such as NILE, OSTK, ZLC, AMZN, and TIF have a tough time passing on to strapped bargain-hunting consumers as easily as brick-and-mortar retailers like ZLC and SIG.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • SWI

    SolarWinds (SWI +1.5%) is outperforming after Jefferies issues a bullish note on the IT systems...

    SolarWinds (SWI +1.5%) is outperforming after Jefferies issues a bullish note on the IT systems management software vendor, following its 2011 analyst day. Jefferies notes SolarWinds issued 2012 revenue guidance of $241M-$249M, which is above a $238M consensus, and thinks its plans to boost product cross-selling efforts could reap huge dividends. (analyst day presentation - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • GSS

    Golden Star Resources (GSS -6.3%) dips after its Q3 swings to a loss as mark-to-market losses...

    Golden Star Resources (GSS -6.3%) dips after its Q3 swings to a loss as mark-to-market losses and lower production offset the benefit of higher gold prices and better margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • HAS

    Hasbro (HAS -6.7%) has dived over the last hour on account of downbeat comments made during the...

    Hasbro (HAS -6.7%) has dived over the last hour on account of downbeat comments made during the toymaker's investor day talks regarding its expected Q2 2012 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics (HDY -23%) gets pounded after its Q3 net loss widened from a year ago, as the oil...

    Hyperdynamics (HDY -23%) gets pounded after its Q3 net loss widened from a year ago, as the oil and gas exploration holding company posted no revenues from operations during the period.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences' (CSC -14.4%) bad year gets worse thanks to the guidance cut attached to its...

    Computer Sciences' (CSC -14.4%) bad year gets worse thanks to the guidance cut attached to its FQ2 report. Blaming "federal budget uncertainty" and one-time charges, the company now expects FY12 revenue of $16.5B-$16.7B and EPS of $4.05-$4.10, compared with prior guidance of $16.5B-$17B and $4.70-$4.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • SVU

    Already having a big year, dealmaking in the grocery business is set to jump even more as...

    Already having a big year, dealmaking in the grocery business is set to jump even more as regional players seek to size up. One firm on the radar screen is Supervalu (NYSE:SVU), primed for acquisition or break-up as it tries to shed debt from its $12.4B purchase of Albertsons in 2006.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott International (MDR -5%) dips after its Q3 missed estimates earlier today. Profits fell...

    McDermott International (MDR -5%) dips after its Q3 missed estimates earlier today. Profits fell 47% Y/Y as the energy-services company booked $50M in losses related to projects in its Atlantic operations, weighing on bottom line margins and offsetting stong revenue growth in Asia.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • PAAS

    Pan American Silver (PAAS -8.1%) dips after its Q3 results came in short of expectations this...

    Pan American Silver (PAAS -8.1%) dips after its Q3 results came in short of expectations this morning. FX losses and a negative adjustment weighed on its bottom line, despite a 34% Y/Y jump in revenue. The company also reduces its FY11 silver production forecast, now expecting 22.5M tons, down from previous estimates of 23M - 24M tons.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • PULS-OLD

    Pulse Electronics (PULS-OLD +10.09%) pops after its Q3 results easily beat Street estimates....

    Pulse Electronics (PULS-OLD +10.09%) pops after its Q3 results easily beat Street estimates. Wireless segment sales jumped 22% Y/Y due to a significant increase in its new antenna customer base. The company reafirms FY11 guidance near the top of its range.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • KITD

    Shares of KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +27.5%) soar after the firm announces an "upward revision bias"...

    Shares of KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +27.5%) soar after the firm announces an "upward revision bias" to its previously issued FY12 revenue guidance. The company says it will look at regional competitors for possible acquisitions, funded by using future operating cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA -7.9%) dips despite beating Q3 estimates, as its net profit swings to a loss due to...

    Sina (SINA -7.9%) dips despite beating Q3 estimates, as its net profit swings to a loss due to heavy write-downs and higher expenses. Gross margin fell to 56% from 60% a year earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 1 Comment

  • Tullow Oil (TUWOY -7.8%) dips after the company cuts its full-year production guidance, saying a...

    Tullow Oil (TUWOY -7.8%) dips after the company cuts its full-year production guidance, saying a Liberian exploration well had proved to be non-productive. However, it remains upbeat about receiving approval for a major Ugandan investment project by year-end.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (ADBE -7.9%) says it will stop developing Flash for mobile browsers, caving into criticism...

    Adobe (ADBE -7.9%) says it will stop developing Flash for mobile browsers, caving into criticism that Flash is too unstable for smartphones and tablets. It's a defeat for Adobe vs. Apple (AAPL -1.9%) in their long-running battle since Steve Jobs refused to allow Flash on iPhones and iPads, and means that developers may stop using Flash tools to produce video, websites and applications for delivery over mobile browsers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 15 Comments
  • URS

    URS Corp. (URS -6.9%) dips after missing Q3 estimates, as volatile markets forced the...

    URS Corp. (URS -6.9%) dips after missing Q3 estimates, as volatile markets forced the engineering-and-construction company to write down the goodwill value of its assets. Core results from its key infrastructure and environment business declined, putting pressure on gross margins which narrowed to 6.9% from 8.7%. Its federal services business also swung to a loss even as revenue rose 11%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • USO

    Ignoring the "risk off" day, WTI crude oil spikes higher, jumping about $2.50 in the space of an...

    Ignoring the "risk off" day, WTI crude oil spikes higher, jumping about $2.50 in the space of an hour to $97.14/barrel. A bullish inventory report at 10:30 may have helped, but it seems like too big of a move for that. USO +0.11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • WEN

    Wendy's (WEN -3.6%) dips on a wider than expected Q3 net loss, primarily due to related charges...

    Wendy's (WEN -3.6%) dips on a wider than expected Q3 net loss, primarily due to related charges from selling most of its Arby's franchise. Better overall pricing and a successful launch of Dave's Hot 'N Juicy cheeseburger boosted the company's bottom line margins, helping to mitigate rising commodity cost pressures and increased marketing expenses. The company reafirms FY11 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • RBCN

    UBS is downgrading Rubicon Technology (RBCN -8%), whose sapphire wafers are used to make LED...

    UBS is downgrading Rubicon Technology (RBCN -8%), whose sapphire wafers are used to make LED chips, following a Q3 report that featured very weak Q4 guidance. UBS is worried about a slower-than-expected ramp of Rubicon's 6" wafers, which carry much higher prices than its smaller wafers. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • CPA

    Latam airline Copa Holdings (CPA -3.6%) dips after its Q3 lands wide of the mark. Profit slid...

    Latam airline Copa Holdings (CPA -3.6%) dips after its Q3 lands wide of the mark. Profit slid 1.7% Y/Y as hedging losses on the price of fuel masked stronger-than-expected core results from a 22% increase in passenger traffic.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (ADBE -10.4%) is getting clocked after issuing a 2012 guidance cut to go with its...

    Adobe (ADBE -10.4%) is getting clocked after issuing a 2012 guidance cut to go with its restructuring plan. JMP and RBC are downgrading shares in response, though others remain bullish: Bernstein is encouraged by Adobe's ongoing transition to a subscription-based revenue model, and Morgan Stanley thinks the company has pricing power for its Creative Suite line that isn't reflected in guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • DISCA

    Discovery Communications (DISCA -4.3%) falls after saying COO Peter Liguori has decided to...

    Discovery Communications (DISCA -4.3%) falls after saying COO Peter Liguori has decided to resign from the company at the year end. The company plans to eliminate the position upon his departure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +5.2%) trades higher after announcing it's acquiring Oceana...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +5.2%) trades higher after announcing it's acquiring Oceana Therapeutics, a privately held provider of gastroenterology and urology therapies, for $300M in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • EZPW

    EZcorp (NASDAQ:EZPW) gains 4.9% after beating estimates and reporting a 31% Y/Y jump in FQ4...

    EZcorp (NASDAQ:EZPW) gains 4.9% after beating estimates and reporting a 31% Y/Y jump in FQ4 profits on strong growth across its segments. The operator of pawn shops in U.S. and Mexico says it expects FY12 EPS to fall in range of $3.05-$3.10.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • ALSK

    Alaska Communications Systems (ALSK -29%) tanks after posting a surprise loss on its Q3 EPS due...

    Alaska Communications Systems (ALSK -29%) tanks after posting a surprise loss on its Q3 EPS due to heavy derivatives losses. Revenue growth was flat Y/Y as gains in roaming revenue were largely offset by declines in its retail service and CETC revenue. However, the company still manages to reaffirm FY11 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • FSYS

    Fuel Systems (FSYS -12.5%) gets hit on a disappointing Q3 report as its EPS swings to a loss on...

    Fuel Systems (FSYS -12.5%) gets hit on a disappointing Q3 report as its EPS swings to a loss on higher tax expenses and operational costs. Gross profit declined 5% Y/Y, due to lower margins in the U.S. automotive business, plus a one-time write off of relocation expenses. The company says the pressure on its margins is ongoing into the current quarter, and lowers its outlook for FY11 to the bottom end of its range.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATVI

    In spite of beating Q3 estimates, lifting 2011 guidance, and receiving positive ink from...

    In spite of beating Q3 estimates, lifting 2011 guidance, and receiving positive ink from Deutsche and others (I, II), Activision (ATVI -4.8%) is selling off today. One area of concern is an 800K Q/Q drop in World of Warcraft subscribers, to 10.3M. World of Warcraft subs pay $15/month, and Activision's cost of sales for the game amounted to less than $60M in Q3, making it a huge cash cow. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 2 Comments
  • BBY

    Those two specks of green in the S&P 500? Best Buy (BBY +2.4%) and Office Depot (ODP +1.7%)....

    Those two specks of green in the S&P 500? Best Buy (BBY +2.4%) and Office Depot (ODP +1.7%). There's no particular news for Best Buy, but insiders have been buyers of Office Depot lately.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • CONN

    Shares of Conn's (CONN -7.6%) retreat knocking out a huge gain yesterday on the retailer's...

    Shares of Conn's (CONN -7.6%) retreat knocking out a huge gain yesterday on the retailer's earnings beat and upped guidance. Despite the selloff, the company still stands as a sector outperformer with an impressive 113% YTD return and claims two Overweight and two Hold ratings from analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT), a Latin American/Caribbean version of Costco, drops 19.2% after...

    PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT), a Latin American/Caribbean version of Costco, drops 19.2% after reporting FQ4 revenue of $436M (+22% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.42, missing consensus by $8.7M and $0.12. The company is also reporting its net warehouse club sales rose 23.9% in October, and that same-store sales rose 18.9% during the month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • RAD

    Credit Suisse analyst Ed Kelly fires up a call on drugstore names, slotting shares of Rite Aid...

    Credit Suisse analyst Ed Kelly fires up a call on drugstore names, slotting shares of Rite Aid (RAD +2.2%) with an Outperform rating and dropping Walgreen (WAG -3.1%) a notch to Neutral. He links his outlook on the companies to the ongoing Walgreen-Express Scripts (ESRX -2.2%) dispute, saying Rite Aid could see a 6% boost to its EBITDA from the fracas.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH), a provider of revenue optimization services for hospitals, is down 10.7%...

    Accretive Health (AH), a provider of revenue optimization services for hospitals, is down 10.7% after reporting Q3 revenue of $218.9M (+38% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.11, missing consensus by $3.4M and $0.01. Accretive, which claims delayed contract signings will hurt 2011 sales, is guiding for full-year revenue of $820M-$835M and EPS of $0.42-$0.44, compared with a consensus of $824.7M and $0.45.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • PMFG

    Shares of PMFG fall 6.7% after the firms reports FQ1 results below the estimates of analysts....

    Shares of PMFG fall 6.7% after the firms reports FQ1 results below the estimates of analysts. The firm's $0.07/share loss was narrower than last year, but missed the consensus of a penny profit. The company says it was hit by customer-requested delays in shipment dates that will push the project revenue and profit margin to later quarters in FY12.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • DWA

    Dreamworks (DWA -5.6%) is downgraded to Sell from Neutral at Janney with a lowered price target...

    Dreamworks (DWA -5.6%) is downgraded to Sell from Neutral at Janney with a lowered price target of $12, based on disappointing early results from its Puss in Boots movie, potential cannibalization from its Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) deal, and declining DVD sales. The Street is too optimistic about the rebound in Puss In Boots, and Janney questions the prospects of upcoming films.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • GS

    In a 10-Q filing today, Goldman Sachs (GS -3.9%) discloses that AIG has threatened to sue over...

    In a 10-Q filing today, Goldman Sachs (GS -3.9%) discloses that AIG has threatened to sue over its MBS dealings with the firm. Goldman also raises its expectations of costs stemming from mortgage-related lawsuits from $485M to $15.8B.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM | 4 Comments
  • ROVI

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) -28.2% premarket after the company issued downward guidance last night, but...

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) -28.2% premarket after the company issued downward guidance last night, but Canaccord maintains a Buy on the shares with a lowered $63 price target: "Our lowered estimates are the result of expected declines in non-core businesses. ROVI’s core businesses remain strong... [We] remain confident that numerous growth opportunities exist in 2011 and beyond."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • YONG

    Shares of Yongye International (NASDAQ:YONG) move 11.6% higher premarket after the firm reports a 96% Y/Y jump in Q3 revenue to $141M.
